result.execSummary:
The defendant Brodie J Seaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
Reimburse $210.00  to Walworth County Drug Unit within 6 months.
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
No contact with CI.  No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medications without a valid prescription.

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 08-02-2022 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges. 

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
Complete 100 hours community service work without buyout option.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brodie J Seaver in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Brodie J Seaver. Called @ 3:31 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing as to both files - 21CF440 and 22CF43. Record by Atty. Pruden who reads the agreement into the record. Court addresses the defendant and goes over maximum penalties and plea questionnaire. Defendant responds to questions of the Court. 
Defendant pleads GUILTY to count #2 in file 21CF440 with remaining counts dismissed and read-in.
Defendant pleads GUILTY to count #1 in file 22CF43 with remaining counts dismissed and read-in.
Attorney Pruden responds to questions of the Court regarding plea. Court finds plea to be knowing, voluntary and intelligent, and finds defendant guilty. 
Record by the State who asks the Court to adopt the facts in criminal complaints for factual basis. No objection by Atty. Pruden. State asks that the Court adopt the agreement of the parties as to sentence. Atty. Pruden joins in that request. Defendant does not wish to make a statement to the Court. 
Court addresses defendant and will adopt the agreement of the parties. Court goes over firearm restrictions, voting rights, and appeal rights. 
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.

SENTENCES:

On 21CF440 - 
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On 22CF43 - 
Sentence withheld and Defendant placed on Probation for a period of three (3) years with the following conditions:
Forty- five (45) days in the Walworth County Jail to commence on or before August 2, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges.
Complete 100 hours of community service work during period of probation with NO BUYOUT.
Pay court costs.
Reimburse buy money in the amount of $210.00 to the Walworth County Drug Unit within six (6) months.
Counseling as recommended by the Agent and engagement in treatment recommended by the Department.
Obtain and maintain employment. 
No contact with the C.I. 
Possess no weapons
No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medications without a valid prescription. 
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
**NO EXPUNCTION OR REQUEST FOR EARLY TERMINATION OF PROBATION**

Defendant Brodie J Seaver in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DA Wiedenfeld.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Brodie J Seaver. Called @ 3:13 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was set for plea and sentencing as to both files - 21CF440 & 22CF43. Record by Atty. Pruden that matters have resolved but defendant needs time to get affairs in order for entering plea. Asks for short continuance. Court grants. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brodie J Seaver appeared in court, Attorney Larry R Pruden appeared in court for Brodie J Seaver, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 3:26 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 2nd status on 21CF440 and 1st status on 22CF43. Record by Atty. Pruden that the defendant wishes to accept the offer of the state, but asks that date be set out about 60 days. Court grants request. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver form filed.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CF43 & 21CF440

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  M.H. (dob 3/18/2005) or H.B. (dob 6/5/04). NO CONTACT WITH CONFIDENTIAL INFORMANT IF KNOWN. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 4:34 PM. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brodie J Seaver appeared in court. Attorney Larry Pruden appeareed. Defendant wishes to waive PH on 22CF43. Court goes over waiver with defendant and responds to court's questions. Court finds waiver knowingly, freely, intelligently made and binds defendant over. Information not yet filed. Record by state that will be same. Attorney Pruden moves forward with arraignment. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Bond in 21CF440 to cover this file. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
